answers.answer: Hi,I would think it could be caused by either...I have weird sensations and all my peripheral nerve testing was 'normal'.it could also be due to something totally unrelated to MS, like diabetes....Sally
It can be caused by either, in the context of MS, but I think it is more likely to be a spinal lesion.Quix

question: Can foot and leg numbness be caused from MS brain lesions, or would it have to be from spinal cord lesions?Stacey
title: Foot and Leg numbness?
